Hotel La Falaise Yaounde: The staff was very friendly and helped out in communication even in matters that did not concern the hotel (due to a language issue)

The fact that the AC was on as I was getting in the room. The weather is pretty hot and that felt like a relief. The staffs are also nice and welcoming. Some of the items in the shower were broken. I had stomach pains from eating their spice at the hotel restaurant.

The hotel is very centrally located which helped me get around to meetings easily! The staff was very friendly, quick to respond, and very supportive. Communication prior to arrival for pick-up went very well and without problems. Can absolutely recommend the hotel for business trips! I missed a hairdryer. It doesn't seem to be standard in many hotels in the region I found, but it is something I'd expect in a hotel of this standard.
Excellent location and airport shuttle Nothing

Location in the city center close to cathedral (15 min) walking and to the main market. Good room but not very big. Small swimming pool. Good restaurant for good dinner and breakfast nice buffet. Very nice staff. Wifi good. They have their own bus for airport transfer. Nice bar with welcome drink
Bedroom was excellent. Air condition was not working properly

oh yes we ordered an extra airport service but it didnt show up so we need to get a taxi at the airport. Even though we have the confirmation and at the reception desk says we didnt confirmed so who was it if it was not the hotel ? not doing what confirmed
Great and knowledgeable staff. Clean and comfortable rooms. some rooms are too close to loud music from outside.
Shower door in my room broken. Not sure that proper maintenance checks are done rerularly.

The rooms were as expected. An added bonus, the hotel had taxis ready for hire. We took advantage and had a driver take us all around Yaounde, showing us all of the tourist spots-the top of Mont Febe, Reunification Monument, National Museum and Independence Monument/Plaza. He also took us to an artisanat/handicraft location for shopping. It was 5,000 frs an hour which was not bad for all he did. We ate breakfast every morning, there was an omelet station and plenty of options, however it was the same options every day. We had drinks by the pool and a pizza at the bar. No complaints. The staff are all very friendly and much mor bilingual than I am. Also, Mahima grocery store is a block away if you need anything. Overall, great location with a park/bois across the street. There were some mis-steps with house keeping. We were left without any towels on the second day and one of the days we seemed to be missing a top sheet. There was the usual brief power outages, to be expected in Cameroon, waiting for the hotel generator to kick in. Nothing that was terribly worrisome or that couldn't be resolved easily.
Also, Booking.com had the location pinned wrong in the map.

There is no wide variety of hotels in Yaounde and the ones fit for western standards are ridiculously expensive. This hotel is OK if you need to stay for a couple of days. Its safe, the basics are there and the food is good. Too much street noise.

great location the shower heater was not working

Very professional staff and good breakfast

The breakfast here is very good: fresh fruits, good coffee, lovely pastries and bread, cheese and yoghurt. The rooms are clean, including the bathroom. Service is excellent. The staff were nice and they tried to help when they could. The lobby of the hotel is very dark and not a lot of space so you'll see so many people there. Check-in was quite slow including check-out. The rooms were very small and not worth the amount you pay for the hotel.

Location is good enougth. It is easy from airport (30minutes) and close to a lot of interesting places for me. Breakfast is also OK. Not a lot of choice but enougth. Food quality (room service) was also correct. This hotel is practicing the over booking. I arrived during the evening and the hotel shuttle drives me at an other hotel indicating me that there is no place in La falaise! Not happy we finally accpet the proposal. Taking the luggages, going to reception, we discover that this hotel (Le Franco) has also no more room !!! After 30 minutes waiting they drive us to a second partner hotel( The congress) where some rooms were available. We were 3 persons in the shuttle and I discover the day after that we were more than 10 person in the same case. This last hotel The congress was a much lower service level ( 2 stars) and cost half of the price. This is the first tome I'm seeing an hotel acting like this. They never informed us aboutthe situation. Unbelievable. I will never book this hotel again.
We had already booked online and gave them our arrival time and the flight number. When we got there, they told it's fully booked!

 Le personnel est très attentionn La Falaise Bonapriso. On sent que des efforts sont faits pour rendre un service parfait aux clients. Que ce soient les vigiles à l'extérieur, les stewards, les employés du restaurant. Tout le monde a le sens du service. C'est une qualité tellement peu commune au Cameroun qu'elle vaut le coup d'être soulignée ici. L'établissement a moins d'un an, mais il y a déjà des dégâts des eaux dans certaines chambres. Nous avons dû demander deux fois à changer de chambre. Heureusement, nos demandes ont toujours été traitées avec la plus grande attention. Aussi, la piscine est vraiment petite, et très peu profonde. Pour l'amateur de natation que je suis, c'est une déception.

La villa des lys: The Villa des lys is probably what price perfomance concerns the best choice in Yaounde. Very friendly staff. Everything is very clean and tasteful. In the evening the rich and beautiful meet here around the pool. The food was very good, unfortunately the breakfast always something was missing, such as jam, a plate or a knife. That according to a previous rating, while showering the shower handle must hold in the hand, I can confirm. Should actually changed in may. But they were all small things, I liked it very much and I would come back.

The facility is very well situated, generally very clean and pleasant, with a beautiful sight of part of Yaounde city when at the garden. Overall, it feels good being there both for relaxation and quiet working mornings. The bathroom set up of the room I occupied needs some improvement to avoid the whole room becoming swamped in water each time one takes a shower. The quality of lights in the room need improved to enable one work or read comfortably.

I disliked the outdoor music, specifically because some vulgar music were often played ( some of the "choice songs" played explicitly said the equivalent of go f*** yourself which is en***le in French). That song was played every day while I stayed there. I should have said something then, I agree. I didn't, so I'm doing it now. I hope management will be more considerate and mindful of the type of music played at their beautiful villa.

Sehr nettes und herzliches Personal. Die Zimmer sauber und ordentlich. Sehr gutes Frühstück und Essen im Restaurant. Bei der Nutzung des Zimmers im hinteren Hof, ist die Dusche nur mit Vorhang zu nutzen, dabei schwimmt aber das ganze Bad. Am Bett löst sich das Kopfteil.

Tout le personnel a été incroyable! Le service magnifique! Ils ont fait tout le necessaire pour me faire sentir comme chez moi. La terrace est très sympa! Un peu de moisissure dans la salle de bain, par contre le nettoyage et toujours très bien fait!

Le personnel est très serviable et à l'écoute des âtre tes des clients. Les extérieurs sont très agréables, la piscine est très sympa également. J ai apprécié le calme des extérieurs et la vigilance des serveurs et de la direction afin que les clients du restaurant respectent un niveau sonore propre à une fête mais raisonnable pour ne pas déranger les résidents. La proximité des groupes électrogènes qui 'sonorisent' bien les chambres. Ce problème devrait être réglé rapidement, ils s'y atèle. Les salle de bains pourraient être mieux équipées en produit, c'est la norme au dessus d'un certain nombre d'étoiles. C est une maison d'hôtes, pas un hôtel mais un soin particulier devrait être apport la qualité et la variété des produits servis au petit-déjeuner. Concernant les tarifs et au regard De autres établissements que j ai fréquenté, je trouve que le prix des chambres est un peu surévalué.

Ottima posizione presso il Caffè di Yaoundé L'hotel formato da piccoli appartamenti è immerso nel.verde Gli spazi comuni sono bellissimi e il personale meraviglioso (tutti con una menzione speciale per Catherina) Tutto nuovo e bello La stanza era piccola il bagno piccolissimo ma ogni appartamento è differente

Overall, the stay here was comfortable for my wife, who is Cameroonian, myself, an American, and our son, a 16-month year old boy. We stayed at the Douala design hotel before this property and we preferred that property to this one for all but one important category: the airport shuttle. The shuttle to/from the airport was extremely convenient and perfect for travelers not wanting to fuss with arranging transportation and haggling (or alternatively getting over-charged). The staff was friendly on the whole, but there were times when they were a bit inattentive, like in the dining area. Also, the pillows were a bit oversized for those who sleep on their bellies. It made for a restless night for both my wife and I. The rooms were clean, but were small and felt a bit dated.

Ambience. Hygiene and good rooms. The staff I didn't understand at all. 
When I check out, they said I hire Taxi and go to the airport by myself. Is really annoyed me. 
My company wants to have contract so that we stay always when we came to Douala but their staff are having which problem, didn't know as they never allow me to talk with the management of Ibis hotel. 
Morning breakfast doesn't have much options. Many times it get finished and many goes without having anything. I honestly didn't understand.

The location, ambience absolutely impeccable!. It surpassed my expectation, it was my first time in Doula, Cameroon.

Everything else apart from the abovementioned experience was great. A receptionist charged my card for another guest's account. When I brought it to her attention during a phone call, she ardently refused to acknowledge that she might have made a mistake. I had to leave my office to come show her the debits from my account (Mind you, I have a very busy schedule but I needed to sort this issue immediately as I was checking out the next day @ 6:20am to catch my flight) . Upon investigation of the cash up for the day I checked in (which I asked her to pull out) , l realized her blunder by observing the last 4 digits of my card which was charged twice (Once under my name and the second time under a different guest's name). Whether that was an honest mistake is a different issue on its own... @Onomo Douala, teach your staff better customer service when it comes to disputes raised by guests even in the event of the guests actually being wrong. In this case, I was very right!

L'hotel est situ proximité de l'aéroport, ce qui est un plus car le vol arrive très tard le soir et repart très tot le matin. L'hotel dispose d'une navette et l'on peut prendre un petit déjeuner de base pour ceux qui partent avant l'ouverture du petit déjeuner. Le petit déjeuner est très copieux et les mets proposés sont très bons, avec une sélection locale et internationale, du chaud et du froid. La chambre est spacieuse, le lit et les coussins sont confortables et il y a beaucoup de prises électriques, éparpillées un peu partout dans la pièce. La douche est propre, les serviettes de bain sont grandes et ont une bonne texture. Bon choix au niveau des chaines de télévision disponibles. Bouteilles d'eau en chambre. Le personnel au check in/out et au restaurant principal est très gentil. Etablissement bien sécurisé. L'espace de rangement pour les habits est un peu minimaliste. Le bouton de réglage de la climatisation est situé prés de la porte, donc il faut quitter son lit ou le plan de travail pour modifier. Le personnel de la terrasse en bord de piscine vous ignore totalement si vous n'allez pas les relancer.

Une très agréable surprise! Hôtel vraiment très agréable: flambant neuf. Du chauffeur Hamidou, ponctuel à l'aéroport à tout le personnel aimable, serviable, attentionné et impeccable. Propreté exemplaire. Espaces bien conçus. Chambre très confortable et bien isolée phoniquement. Literie: un délice! Piscine pas très grande mais agréable et très propre. La cerise sur le gâteau: le restaurant. Bravo le chef! Nourriture variée et excellente. Et pour démarrer la journée, un super, super petit déjeuner. Ma devise pourrait être la devise de l'hôtel: "Il vaut mieux viser l'excellence et s'en approcher que la médiocrité et l'atteindre". Vous êtes proches de l'excellence: vraiment une belle réussite, merci, continuez. C'est super! NB: l'hôtel est tout récent mais moi qui suis dans la profession, travaux de belle qualité. Beaux matériaux et belles finitions Pas grand chose! Une faute sur un panneau d'ascenseur!!!!!!!!!!! L'hôtel est bâti sur un espace restreint Suggestion: un petit plus serait une bouilloire dans la chambre avec quelques sachets de thé ou de café

Onomo es un hotel que recomendaría para tu estancia en Douala, las habitaciones son cómodas, el desayuno variado y muy rico, las instalaciones son nuevas, bonitas y de calidad y el hotel esta bien ubicado. Petit déjeuner très complet et de qualité . Personne qualifié et pro actif, aimable et au petits soins,chose rare au Cameroun . Ambiance jeune et business relax dans la grande salle du restaurant . Television en chambre avec image de qualité, pas le brouillard classique comme ailleurs au Cameroun. Le service en chambre doit être demandé . Cela devrait être mentionné au check in . En entrant dans la chambre, le sol de la douche était mouillé et le carrelage de la chambre montrait des traces de pieds nus. SInon c'était propre.

la disponibilité du personnel à aider les clients L'absence d'un bagagiste pour aider à porter les bagages des clients

Hôtel tout neuf. Les chambres sont assez spacieuses comparé aux autres hôtels de Douala. La clim est silencieuse, possibilité d ouvrir les fenêtres. Le personnel est agréable, l établissement est bien tenu. Nous n'avons pas testé le petit déjeuner ni le restaurant cependant. Il conviendrait d'améliorer la qualité du nettoyage des chambres. Et mettre suffisamment de serviettes de toilette. Une seule pour deux personnes!!

Etablissement tout neuf et très bien aménagé. Bon confort et très bonne réalisation (par rapport aux habitudes locales). Petit déjeuner buffet exemplaire, frais, varié et très couleur locale. Les repas en buffet sont également très bien. Tout le personnel est adorable et compétent! Juste un petit détail, la diode de veille du téléviseur dans la chambre est d'un bleu vif trop intense pour la nuit et comme elle est dans l'axe du lit: on en prend plein les yeux...

Le menu du petit dejeuner est parfait. J'ai apprecie le melange de culture qui y apparait. Le menu offre des mets occidentaux et africains ( Camerounais). J'ai adore le menu B+B+H, la trilogie qui a bercer notre adoslescence: Beignets + Haricot+ Bouillie. La proprete des lieux est irreprochable. J'ai adore l'eclatante blancheur des draps, serviettes et la douceur du lit. Cependant, je suis un peu reste sur ma faim lorsqu'il s'est agi du haricot les deux premiers jours (ceux presentes etaient semblables aux lentilles) et ne correspondent pas a l'image que nous avons de ce menu tres prise par les camerounais. J'en ai parle avec la responsable de la restauration, en lui demandant de revenir a l'habituel haricot ' rouge' de grand mere pour boucler la boucle. Ce qui fut fait le dimance 15 septembre 2019 jour de mon depart de l'hotel pour mon boheur Pour un nouvel etablissement, il serait un peu tot de dire qu'on n'a pas apprecie. Des travaux etaient encore en cours au moment de notre depart; le second portail par exemple. Il serait important de resoudre tres vite la question des communications internes par telephone et considerer egalement l'augmentation du nombre de bouteilles d'eau en chambbre. Onomo Kigali ou j'ai sejourne recemment en offre deux par jours... comme la plupart des hotels d'ailleurs.
La propreté et l'ergonomie de la chambre Personnel froid en dehors de la chef d'accueil. Vue extérieure a travers la fenêtre très très moche

Thus price does not match service provided.
 then they took me to another place than booked. first i was confused wether i was the right customer who got picked up but it was all correct. there are motors everywhere in town and a ride is just 300CFA to town. i ended up in a 80-90sqm apartment with a kitchen, 2 bathrooms, 1 additional toilet, 2 bedrooms and a living room - well furnished. the location where i stood seems to be a safe area. additionally the place has its own security. 
there was no wifi but they arranged a mobile router. all good. the airport pick up was a bit complicated.

Tight underground parking.
 Just the fact that it was closer to the travel agency No toiletries except towel and half tissue paper. Had to take shower without soap the day I arrived.
 This place is located in downtown Douala, in one of the best areas of the city.
Their Internet connection was of great quality. This place deserve a score ZERO ! I book there because I was pleased by the price that they were offering when all the hotel in this areas was much more expensive. I booked there because I found them on Booking.com, a website that I trusted to recommend good places. This is no longer the case !
This is not an hotel : It is a building of 7 floors divided in private apartments, office spaces, and where people like me, who did not have a clue, are put in rooms without basic hotel services.
There is no identification sign at it entrance : It was my first stay in Douala, therefore I had no clue on where Manhantan living was situated. Even the licenced taxi that I used was lost despite the indications that I provided. The taximan had to go around and ask if anyone could tell us where to find Manhantan Living. There street address is 1660 while it was actually 1600.
There is no hotel lobby: Not even a single chair for a guest to rest while waiting for his/her room.
There is no restaurant : When I asked about where their restaurant was located so that I could go there and order a lunch, I have been told they did not have a restaurant and that the breakfast was not included. When I complained, about their false advertisement on Booking.com, which was one of the criteria that made me booked with them, they eventually proposed to serve a breakfast next morning.
I had to spend the first night there, cancelled the remaining nights, and find another accommodation first thing in the morning the following day.
Once paid for that night, I later on realized that they didn't even give me a receipt. Before leaving the next morning, I asked for my receipt. But the person in charge this morning asked me to wait for the manager to get my receipt. I had to go without that receipt otherwise I would have been late for my appointment.
 This time they gave me an apartment with two bedrooms a kitchen with all appliance, a huge living room with all amenities.I was amazed for that reward.May be for me being a good client.Thanks to Manhantan Living
 The place is very clean and well maintained lift and its good no interference Wifi was just not working

This is our second time at Gites de Kribi and most likely we will keep coming back. The things we absolutely love are the included breakfast at the hotel's restaurant - a deck overseeing the ocean, the swimming pool, and the proximity of the beach - across the street. That makes our stay with our children 3yo and 5yo much more enjoyable. We like renting one of the bungalows, because we have the flexibility of cooking food in the kitchen and storing it in the fridge. Cable TV provides entertainment in rainy afternoons. It is easy to have the reception call a taxi for trips to the falls, to the fish market, to SPAR, or to a local restaurant. The hotel's restaurant has rich menu, and live music on Friday nights, and also, as I mentioned above, a great view, overlooking the ocean - perfect for sunset watching. In the back of the property there is a small river (or pond) and available kayak for exploring. Some things seem to be constantly in maintenance. We enjoyed warming up at the jacuzzi the first day, but after that it was unavailable and under repair (that only happened on the third day). There is another jacuzzi, but it never worked. The gym is also under maintenance and not available.

- Staff is extremely polite and friendly. They were very helpful. Always smiling and welcoming. - Food is the best. The restaurant is the best in kribi. No doubt about it. Pizza is one of the most delicious I've ever tasted. Portions are generous. Service is perfect. - Rooms are clean, mattress is comfortable. - Hot water available 24/7. I will try to be as objective as I can, because my remarks are for your own good, and not to ruin your image. Negative points: - You need to make sure that all of your guests are aware of the internal rules regarding noise. Some of your guests are unfortunately uncivilized, and do not care about others' rest. I even heard some of your employees (men) calling each other loudly in front of my door. I suggest you consider a calm environment 24/24, not only between 10pm and 8pm. - Please consider room service. It's annoying that i had to put on my clothes and go out just for a bottle of water. Room service is the least you can do in an hotel. - Coffee machine without coffee. Quite annoying. Right? - Please change your pillows. They are flat and hard. The first night i had neck pain because of them. Your staff was kind enough to change them for me. Don't wait for the customers to complain. - Think of isolating your meeting/conference room, because the room next to it can hear every noise. Conclusion: If i come to kribi for work, i will definitely stay in the Gîtes de kribi. But if for relaxation and peace, i don't think so. Just work on the little details and you'll be number one in Kribi. In a resort like yours, peace and quiet are essential.

Es hat mir sehr gut gefallen, dass das Personal wirklich sehr freundlich war. Die Lage sehr nahe zum Strand ist auch angenehm. Das Essen im angegliederten Restaurant war gut, die Preise für Kamerun ein wenig hoch, aber das ist wohl auch dem Umstand geschuldet, das Kribi ein Touristenziel ist. Die Atmosphäre im Restaurant war sehr nett, es war nie zu laut. Ich konnte mein Auto direkt vor meinem Zimmer parken, dass war natürlich sehr praktisch. Es hat mir nicht gefallen, dass das Gym nicht zu benutzen war, weil die Geräte in einem sehr schlechten Zustand waren. Außerdem hätte ich mir gewünscht, dass es am Strand Sonnenliegen und Sonnenschirme gegeben hätte. Das war aber nicht der Fall. Früher gab es scheinbar Liegen, aber diese lagen verottet auf einem Haufen. Es hielt wohl niemand für notwendig sich darum zu kümmern. Im Zimmer war das Bad in einem schlechten technischen Zustand. Schon bei unserer Ankunft war der Abfluss des Waschbeckens verstopft. Das wurde zwar schnell behoben, aber einem aufmerksamen Housekeeping sollte so etwas auffallen. Das Frühstück bot mehr oder weniger jeden Tag die gleiche Auswahl und man musste sich bemühen früh zu kommen, sonst waren verschiedene Dinge aufgebraucht, Obstsalat z.B., die dann auch nicht mehr aufgefüllt wurden.

L'hotel m'a bien plu, mais j'ai eu une experience désagréable que je relaterai ci-dessous. J'ai pris un chauffeur qui travaille en partenariat avec l'hotel pour une excursion. Le prix avait été fixé d'avance mais il y a eu malentendu avec le chauffeur sur la question de la devise dans lequel le prix a été fixé. Moi je parlais très clairement en dollars, lui en milliers de CFA. Au retour, j'ai demand la reception de contacter la personne de la reception qui était present. Il a confirmé ma version des faits. Le chauffeur a demand la personne responsible des relations avec la clientele - Emmanuelle Tiokeng - d'intervenir. J'ai propose de couper la poire en deux, mais elle n'était pas prête à un compromise. Elle estimait que la seule solution était que je paie la totalité de la somme voulue par le chauffeur. Elle m'a dit que Alain, entre temps, avait change de version (sans doute sous pression) et m'a fait chanter, menacant des problems avec la police si je métais pied dehors. J'ai fini par contacter le chauffeur et nous avons tout de suite trouvé un compromise acceptable pour les deux côtés. Le personnel de l'hotel, et en premier la Guest Relations Manager, devrait defendre ses clients. Au contraire, ils se sont rués sur moi avec menace et chantage et ont systématiquement refuse de chercher un compromise (que j'ai moi-même trouvé, sans difficulté). Je ne mettrai plus les pieds dans cet hôtel et je propose à des clients potentiels de chercher ailleurs. Quant à Emmannuelle Tiokeng, elle devrait chercher un autre travail - un qui ne nécessite pas de contact avec des êtres humains.

Bolo Residence Douala:
The host, Edith, is amazing! She is very responsive and helps where she can. Exceptionally supportive! The apartment was very clean and felt comfortable with nice furnishing and little accents in the decoration that make you feel at home. The breakfast is served every day - if you book the option - at your timely convenience which I found very cool! They even asked if we wanted some things changed in the menu, which included a lot of food. Edith and her team really work hard to tailor their service to the needs of their guest. It was great to have two separate rooms for me and my colleague. Can absolutely recommend the place if you go as a team. And the price for the comfort, size of apartment, and service is a good bargain! The only downside maybe was the noisy and busy neighborhood and the fact that free internet is pegged at 1.5 GB which means if you need to work from home, you have to be very conservative with your usage. I am a light sleeper and the street outside is busy all night with music and crowds of people. I didn't expect that kind of neighborhood but it felt safe nonetheless. Just be aware that getting a taxi requires either requesting one through the staff way ahead of time or walking through crowds of people and motorbike drivers. I was with a local colleague, so it was alright. But if you're new and alone, it might be a bit challenging at first.
 great art works
 All organised correctly.
 What I liked the most was the decoration of the apartment. I really loved the seeling in the livingroom and the big closed in each bedroom. The location was perfect! I was amazed of the security of the residence. There was always a doorman. Everybody that come to visit you need to show her/his ID. At around 6pm, they close the second entry to the apartments. Only the guests have the key to excess this door. So yes, I really love this place and will definitely stay there again. And btw a big thumbs up to Mrs. Mbella (the owner) for her hospitality, kindness and professionality. The Wifi connection was sometimes slow, but it was Ok. I was already happy I can connect.
 As usual my experience was excellent. I was picked up at the airport and the driver waited for me even through a long delay of my flight. Because my room was already occupied I was upgraded with no problems at all. This is my second time staying at the Bolo Residence and my second experience was just as great as the first. Everybody really cares and pays attention to detail. I had a beautiful apartment with a gorgeous front area. 
I had some issues with my flight that needed to be resolved and was offered help without even having to ask. All in all the place is amazing and feels like a quiet oasis in the middle of a bustling city. The Bolo has now become my number 1 destination in Douala! I'll be glad to come back soon! It's clean, and the staff members are friendly and genuinely helpful!
 This hotel is absolutely great value for money! The apartments are clean, the sheet and towels impeccably white and the staff is very professional. I have dealt with 3 different people and they were all highly professional and friendly. I used the transport to the airport but was also picked up at my arrival from a different location. Communication was A1! And they were perfectly on time (even early). I will definitively come back to this hotel! Although there is no restaurant all you have to do is step out and you will be able to enjoy different types of grilled meats, fish and vegetables

 Le professionnalisme de l'Hôtel et la fiabilité du personnel. Mme Edith Mbella est régulièrement soucieuse du bien être de ses clients et grandes disponibilités de M Emmanuel TCHOUNGA (son adjoint) pour renseigner sur : sites géographiques, appels de taxis climatisés, bons restaurants avec leurs spécialités, commente agréablenent la galerie d'art qui se trouve au R.C., il est joignable également facilement par téléphone ce qui est un avantage certain dès lors qu'on est en extérieur de la Résidence. Staben der var veldig, veldig hyggelige, og vi klarte som regel å komme i mål på tross av tidvis manglende engelskkunnskaper (hovedspråket er fransk). 
Selv om hotellet lå midt i byen var det faktisk ikke så aller verst mtp lyd. Min favorittplass ble etterhvert å se solnedgangen fra en tak"terasse" i 2. etg. 
Sikkerheten var og høyt ivaretatt, og vi følte oss trygge på både området og taxien som ble bestilt til returen. 
De holdt åpent for oss selv da vi kom med flyet klokken 3 på morgenen. 
De hadde et fint basseng å kjøle seg ned i, noe som var helt kritisk for en varm nordmann. 
Maten var helt fantastisk! Frokosten ble, for min del, omelett og rundstrykke (og croissant, når de hadde det). De har, av uante grunner, ikke noe tilbud på drikke til frokost, så du bør ta med egen vannflaske, men du får til gjengjeld div frukt om du ber om det. God start på dagen. 
"a la carte" var ikke så lett å få bestilt fra, det gikk mer i om man ville ha fisk, biff eller kylling, men alle tre alternativene var helt nydelige. Selv min sarte mage tålte det. Snakker du fransk er det garantert mye enklere. Hehe. Beliggenheten er fin for folk som ikke skal være så mye på hotellet. Vi fikk ikke "lov" (som to kritthvite jenter) å gå for mye rundt i området av de vi besøkte, hvilket begrenser litt hvor mye man får gjort når man ikke er ute på forskjellige oppdrag så man blir litt fanget på hotellet om man ikke hele tiden vil være med de man kjenner i området. 
Så fin beliggenhet om man er der for business og blir fraktet hit og dit, men skal du oppleve Kamerun ville jeg dratt langt utenfor byene (f.eks til Douala Edea National Park)
Bassenget kunne hatt et par solsenger, men det gikk helt fint uten. 
Madrassen hadde den rareste resonansen jeg har vært borti

 L'appartement, le personnel. Le Djeuga appart est très bien situé, au centre de la ville de Yaoundé presque face au Hilton hôtel. Le personnel, les équipements parfait. L'appartement est spacieux très propre et moderne. Les seuls inconvénients sont les bruits de la circulation, des klaxons. Sans oublier les militaires qui gardent la tribune présidentielle qui arnaquent les étrangers qui prennent des photos aux alentours car nous aussi nous avons été victimes. Ils arrachent le téléphone et vous demande de payer une amende, nous avons payé 10.000fcfa(15€)pour récupérer le téléphone de mon mari parce qu'il a pris des photos du Djeuga appart côté boulevard du 20mai. A cause de ma fille de 5 ans en panique, j'ai dû me dépêcher pour régler ce problème. Le secteur n'est pas très sécurisé dès la fermeture des magasins, évitez de sortir la nuit vous balader. Sinon très bel établissement.

 When eating any hotel in Cameroon, you have to remember, the hotel is in Cameroon. This is one of the four best hotels in Douala. It is fantastic the way prices have dropped at these top hotels in the last few years, making them much better value. Douala is a difficult city to visit and this hotel is a comfortable and calm oasis in the city. The staff are five star at this hotel, going out their way to ensure a smooth, convenient and comfortable stay.
The hotel has working showers, consistent electricity supply, working televisions, air conditioning and a refreshing and deep swimming pool.
The wifi is really good, surprisingly good. It is complimentary and only had connectivity issues for a few hours during my stay. It doesn't have an on-site gym
Quite far away from the up and coming northern suburbs such as Bonamoussadi, though very convenient for the port, French consulate and central Douala.
The breakfast is not very Western, though quite ample if to your tastes.

I usually never leave reviews but for this, I had to! My partner and I have just returned from a trip to Douala and stayed at this hotel. I didn't know what to expect but I was pleasantly happy with the level of comfort in our room. The room was just what we needed with AC, TV, and hot water always working. The hotel gives you a sense of home feeling. I would definitely stay there again and recommend!

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I was hesitant at first becuase booking.com said the hotel was just added and they didn't show pictures for my room type. The hotel is just minutes from Carrefour BM 89 on a nicely paved residential street which is rare in Dla. My room and bathroom was well clean and the entire property looks very well maintained. I had a budget room which was a bit small but just okay for me and my husband. My bathroom had hot water and the sheets, towels, were white and very clean. It's a new hotel and I hope management keeps it up. Water pressure in my bathroom was excellent and so was the much needed air conditioner in the Dla heat in January. Overall, a very pleasant experience. Also, the food was very very good. Corine is a great chef! Staff was friendly and polite. A great find in the Makepe/Bonamoussadi area. Looking forward to my next stay. No complains....

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I was hesitant at first becuase booking.com said the hotel was just added and they didn't show pictures for my room type. The hotel is just minutes from Carrefour BM 89 on a nicely paved residential street which is rare in Dla. My room and bathroom was well clean and the entire property looks very well maintained. I had a budget room which was a bit small but just okay for me and my husband. My bathroom had hot water and the sheets, towels, were white and very clean. It's a new hotel and I hope management keeps it up. Water pressure in my bathroom was excellent and so was the much needed air conditioner in the Dla heat in January. Overall, a very pleasant experience. Also, the food was very very good. Corine is a great chef! Staff was friendly and polite. A great find in the Makepe/Bonamoussadi area. Looking forward to my next stay.

La Villa Des Fées: Very nice facility, an oasis of calm & civility in the bustle of urban Africa. Excellent service, nice rooms, big bathrooms, lots of hot water & very clean. Marc the manager is great & very helpful. Restaurant also very good. Food very good, service great. Breakfast, while not included is very good. Highly recommended.

The hotel style and design is excellent and classy. Rooms are awesome, clean, spacious, well furnished.
The manager is so friendly, caring and professional. The staff is also wonderful. Security is guaranteed. You have to factor the time in traffic but it's not under the control of the hotel, it's the same everywhere in Douala

An oasis in a very hectic city. Every staff member was kind and wonderful. Marc, the manager, was always available to help with everything and if you are English speaking and not from Cameroon, this is essential! He went out of his way on many occasions to make my stay easier and help with logistics. Staying here was the best decision I made. Everything was clean, up to date and beautiful. The restaurant's food was delicious and full of great options. I was accompanied by local residents of Douala and they said that this was absolutely the best place to stay while in the city. I am a very picky traveler with high standards and I was very, very happy with my stay. This will absolutely be my home base when doing business in Douala from now on.

Villa Des Fees is an exceptional place. More a place that feels like your own home. It is expensive but it is worth every bit of that. Amazing staff, Marc and staff were incredible. Loved the food, the rooms were huge, all facilities and help goes beyond what you would expect. We loved the place and will always return when we go to Cameroon
Mike and Rene Nothing

Très grande propreté des chambres. Hôtel situé au calme (c'est là que j'ai le mieux dormis) pourtant en face de l'accès à la mer et aux chutes de Lobé (une route à traverser 10mn à pieds). Tout ce qu'il faut dans la salle de bain (c'est assez rare) j'ai tout apprécié! cela manque un peu de décoration peut être, le lieu est sobre il serait bien de "l'africaniser" un peu mais c'est un détail pour moi, cela peut compter pour d'autres. Hôtel bien pensé et réalisé avec goût, il offre certaines prestations rares à Kribi : très beau toit-terrasse panoramique avec vue à 360°; chaque chambre a un balcon donnant sur la verdure; accès à une cuisine et une buanderie; bon repas sur commande et café italien le matin; service de chauffeur à prix raisonnable. L'hôtel est bien situé près des chutes de la Lobé et des plages du Grand Batanga, le léger retrait de la mer est largement compensé par l'expérience de passer la nuit en pleine forêt tropicale. Le propriétaire et le personnel sont très sympathiques et disponibles. Nous reviendrons sûrement.

Itondi - Maison d'hôtes: Itondi is a hidden gem away from it all. Lovely home, pool, with an amazingly attentive staff. The WIFI (comes with your booking) is strong throughout the house (two channels to choose from). Coffee was strong. The only drawback is that it is a bit of a way down a hill and if you do not have you own vehicle this is a difficult place to get to. Even the locals complained as to how far it is and the road to it is in rough shape. Other than that. This is a perfect spot if you want to get away and still be relatively close to the center. Distance from main road.

I had a great two night stay at Itondi. The staff is very nice and professional. The room looked exactly like in the pictures. I enjoyed breakfast in the morning on the terrace. I was glad that the room did not have a carpet and the room and the bathroom seemed fairly clean. One of the member of staff at the restaurant was exceptionally helpful, her name is Arlette. The hotel is rated 4 Star hotel, so even for a standard room and at that rate, I expected better quality and comfort. The beddings and towels did not inspire a lot of confidence. I think once upon a time they must have been white but not anymore, they were grayish - brown in colour, therefore I was not sure of their cleanliness. They were also worn out. There was no tea station 😱 I had to negotiate for a kettle and a cup. This was at second attempt. My first request was turned down with an emphatic no. I was told that if I want such amenities I should upgrade to a room more than twice the amount, yet a hotel nearby, of lesser rating had the tea station. The public places like the corridor, which had a carpet, and the elevator were dirty!!! Dust clung to the borders all along the corridor. The cleaning cart which was in the corridor, was a horror. The restaurant, from the ambience to the furnishings, was not nice. The quality of the food was not excellent either. To be honest, I am wondering what is the basis of the rating of 4 Star. May be it is based on the suites? However, my view is that the rating of a hotel should take everything into consideration, holistically. The staff at the reception, some were nice, others I would describe as off-hand. I know that language was a barrier, they speaking French and I English only, but for the most part they did not, in my opinion, make any effort at all. Unless if it was in fine print, I assumed that at that amount, it included breakfast and taxes, but not all. While I could pay in $, no change in $ was available.

La prestation non effectuée nous a été facturée au motif que nous aurions du prévenir l'hôtel de notre arrivée !!!Ce qui était difficile car nous n'avions pas de puce du Cameroun en arrivant de Nouméa.....

Mbayaville Hotel:
Even though we arrived fairly late in the evening, the staff welcomed us very kindly. Compared to other Hotels in Duoala, Mbayaville was very affordable. 
The rooms and facilities are well worth the price. 
Our room was cleaned daily. 
The Manager of the hotel was very invested in our well being, making sure that everything was to our liking. 
As europeans we were very pleased with the standard of the hotel and can only recommend it. We failed to mention that we would like a city view, so our rooms was just facing another building. Never the less there were other rooms with better views but we did't really feel the need of requesting a change.
 Helpful staff
Value for money when considering hotels here are expensive Booking.com should not market the property as 4 star when it is obvious it is not up to mark
 Rooms were very comfortable and emaculately clean No lift, it's nothing like the booking.com description and it's 3 star not 4
 I liked the fact that the staff really took into consideration my safety and wellbeing since it was the first time visiting the city.
I want to thank personally Mr. Alfred Nkerbu who really assited me during my stay at Mbayaville Hotel. If you want someone to be your personal guide while in Doula, he is the man.
 Large and clean bed, wide range of tasty dishes in the restaurant, convenient location close to the Douala Airport (inform them beforehand about your arrival or departure, as they need to organize the shuttle service - a comfortable mini bus with an elegant driver). Dirty bathroom (no division between shower and toilet), dirty room full of dust. Noisy surroundings. Two weeks before arrival we asked if there are any weddings planned, as we wanted to avoid noisy night. The hotel said "no wedding planned". At arrival it appeared that in fact there was a wedding party. They gave us a room two floors higher (no lift), but it was still very noisy, mainly due to loud music from the bars in the street (quite standard for African cities, though...) Also before arrival we asked about possibility to pay by card. It was confirmed, and I tried to pay by my European MasterCard. The reception staff said, that there is something wrong and the payment cannot be processed, so I had to pay in cash. A few days later it appeared, however, that my card was debited - so, we paid twice! The hotel did not react at all to e-mail and message via Facebook (although it was read). I am fighting now to get my money back through booking.com...
So, for one night, before or after your flight, it is OK. Don't bother yourself with credit card, though, pay in cash. It is Africa...

L'établissement est un vrai havre de paix. Un peu à l'écart du centre ville de Kribi le cadre est optimal pour se reposer, c'est une petite propriété avec quelques bungalows juste, rien à voir donc avec l'agitation des grands hôtels. La plage est à 2 pas et le personnel aux petits soins pour répondre à nos besoins. Les produits de la cuisine sont bien frais et on mange très bien. On passe la commande le matin pour le repas du midi et du soir. Le patron est très accueillant et très disponible. Ils nous ont aid organisé la sortie aux chutes de la Lobé et la balade en pirogue sur le fleuve. Tout s'est très bien passé. Nous recommandons absolument. Rien de très grave mais juste une suggestion que nous souhaitons faire. Il y'a eu une coupure d'électricit un moment, ce qui arrive fréquemment au Cameroun. L'établissement n'a pas un groupe électrogène qui prend automatiquement le relais mais nous avons reçu des lampes pour nous éclairer dans les chambres et les espaces communs. Ce serait bien de prévoir quand même un groupe qu'on lancerait quelques heures à la tombée de la nuit avant de l'arrêter pour éviter de s'endormir avec le bruit assourdissant de ces engins. ça peut être gênant pour le cadre calme mais ça permettrait de recharger un peu les appareils.

Très bel hébergement sous forme de maisonnettes dans un magnifique jardin très bien entretenu.
L'environnement est très calme.
Tout le confort est présent (y compris la climatisation). C'est très propre et tout est fonctionnel (salle de bains...)
Le restaurant est très bien aussi. C'est bon, pas trop cher, et aucun problème gastrique à signaler :)
La plage se trouve à 5mins de marche par un petit sentier sauvage (prévoir la torche si on revient après le coucher du soleil). Lors du 1er départ vers la plage, il suffit de suivre les chiens. Les chutes de la Lobé sont à 1H de marche, par la plage.
Les services sur place sont aussi appréciables (guide pour visiter la région, lavage de la voiture).
Pour finir, cette étape de quelques jours à Kribi a été la plus mémorable de notre voyage. On y reviendra. On est arrivé de nuit (merci les bouchons à Douala). Le panneau, indiquant l'hôtel sur la route principale, n'est pas assez visible de nuit. Dans ce cas, un conseil: suivez Google Maps, il vous mènera à bon port.
L'entrée de la route en terre menant à l'hotel (au niveau de la route principale donc), fait un trop gros dénivelé. On tapait quasiment tout le temps le bas de caisse de la voiture, sur le trottoir. Il serait bon de remblayer à cet endroit.

The restaurant is very good too. It's good, not too expensive, and no gastro problems to report :)
-The beach is 5mins walk by a small wild path (plan for the torch if you come back after sunset). When we first go to the beach, just follow the dogs. The Falls de la Lobé are a 1H walk, by the beach.
The services on site are also appreciable (guide to visit the region, washing the car).
Finally, this one-day stop in Kribi was the most memorable of our trip. We will come back.

LA CASA DE MULOS:
My partner and me (from Germany) have stayed 6 nights in La Casa de Mulos and we were so glad to be at this peaceful place. Annie welcomed us so heart warmed, and the driver of the hotel picked us up from the centre in Kribi. After we recognized that the hotel is a bit out of the center, Annie explained us, that we will have our own driver, who is available whenever we want. So, we were really satisfied to be in a quit area and still well connected to the city, to some shopping at the market. Florence (an employee of the hotel) and the driver went with us together to the market to show us, where we can buy what we wanted. The most important thing about going with them, was to don't get subtracted. During the whole time, we felt all the time really save. Also, when we went to the wonderful beach (5min by walk), we felt save, because there was also a little bar with hammocks. It was like a dream for us. We loved the beach and the water. In the afternoon you can go inside the water and have a nice swim. Or you can have walk along the beach (you can walk there for hours). Aaaand there are little waterfalls, which we didn't expect. Another employee of the hotel was our guide to go there by walk (20min). It was an adventure for us, because we also could walk directly in the water holes of the rocks. 
In the evening we had a wonderful time as well, because we played with Annie some typical German table games and we had a lot of nice conversations. Annie gave us the feeling to be our best friend and to have felt like home. 
So, everyone who wants to have some peaceful holidays, is here more then welcome and will find what you are looking for. And for those who are not Cameroonians, can watch the typical life of a family outside the hotel. For us it was impressive, how they are living. Of course, they were friendly as well.
I will stay longer here in Cameroon, that why I probably will come back to La Casa de Mulos. 
Annie thanks for everything again 😉

De passage quelques jours à Kribi , Séjour très agréable mais trop court dans un lieu idyllique. Si le paradis existe je pense que Océan Mansion à Kribi Mboa Manga s'y rapproche. Un véritable jardin d'Eden avec son grand jardin et ses belles fleurs d'hibiscus. Super accueil du propriétaire avec une noix de coco. Personnel très agréable. En plus on pouvait accéder direct sur la plage avec son petit portail privatif. Super la petite kitchenette avec tout le nécessaire pour préparer nos repas. Sinon il y avait aussi des petits vendeurs ambulants avec les spécialités locales(Beignets haricots, poisson ou poulet braisé). Quartier bien desservi avec des petites supérettes et quelques boulangeries (pour les bons beignets frais du matin). Le propriétaire nous a conseillé une super balade à faire : aller jusqu'aux chutes de la Lobé en marchant le long de la plage (un peu périlleux, éviter la marée haute). Pour le dernier soir, le propriétaire nous a fait un feu de camp dans le jardin en nous jouant de la harpe. Très douce soirée inoubliable au milieu du silence et du calme de la nuit intense africaine. Des souvenirs pleins la tête. Endroit à découvrir. Trés envie de revenir. Pour profiter encore plus du jardin et du cadre magnifique penser à des jeux extérieurs comme des raquettes de Badminton ou ballons

 Je ne recommande pas !!! L'accueil laisse à désirer ... le savoir faire et le savoir être n'est pas du tout digne d'un lieu pareil. Nous avons écourté notre séjour car c'est inadmissible de payer une telle somme pour un hôtel 4 étoiles et de voir une telle saleté. Les couloirs de l'étage 4 où l'on se trouvait empestait la moisissure. Les tapis, les murs, le couloir avec des dépôts de vêtements sales ou plateaux de nourriture qui sentent. Dans la chambre insalubre, les wc avec ses traces au sol, la salle de bain avec des traces de moisissures, le lavabo sale ... la poussière sur les lampes, la table basse etc , l'armoire cassée... et j'en passe !!! Nous sommes parti au bout de 2h nous n'avons pas dormi sur place de peur d'attraper des microbes ...
 La vétusté de l'hôtel. Clim bruyante. Réceptionniste peu accueillante à l'arrivée. Réservation pour deux personnes, petit déjeuner compris mais à la sortie on nous dit qu'un seul petit déjeuner était compris dans le prix (on nous fait remarquer que "petit déjeuner compris" sur la confirmation était au singulier. On se sent arnaqué. Taxi de l'hôtel qui ne respecte pas le prix donné au départ malgré des indications claires quant à la destination. La navette de de l'hôtel est arrivée à l'aéroport avec une heure de retard par rapport à l'horaire convenu la veille. De tous les hôtels que j'ai utilisés pendant notre séjour, c'est bien le seul auquel je donne une note pareille.
